column2: JULIA PERFORMS A SACRED DUTY
column3: JULIA PERFORMS A SACRED DUTY

column2: What have we ever done that we should be so neglected? said David Nesbit, swinging himself from his motorcycle and landing squarely in front of Grace Harlowe and Anne Pierson while they were out walking one afternoon.
column3: What have we ever done that we should be so neglected? said David Nesbit, swinging himself from his motorcycle and landing squarely in front of Grace Harlowe and Anne Pierson while they were out walking one afternoon.

column2: Why, David Nesbit, how can you make such statements? replied Grace, looking at the young man in mock disapproval.
column3: Why, David Nesbit, how can you make such statements? replied Grace, looking at the young man in mock disapproval.

column2: You know perfectly well that you've been shut up in your old laboratory all fall.	You know perfectly well that you've been shut up in your old laboratory all fall.
We have scarcely seen you since the walking party.
column3: We have scarcely seen you since the walking party.

column2: That's what comes of having a sister who belongs to a sorority.	That's what comes of having a sister who belongs to a sorority.
However, you folks are equally guilty, you've all gone mad over your sorority, and left Hippy and Reddy and me to wander about Oakdale like lost souls.
column3: However, you folks are equally guilty, you've all gone mad over your sorority, and left Hippy and Reddy and me to wander about Oakdale like lost souls.

column2: I hear you've adopted a girl, too.
column3: I hear you've adopted a girl, too.

column2: Reddy is horribly jealous of her.
column3: Reddy is horribly jealous of her.

column2: He says Jessica won't look at him any more."
column3: He says Jessica won't look at him any more."

column2: Reddy is laboring under a false impression, said Anne.
column3: Reddy is laboring under a false impression, said Anne.

column2: He is head over heels in football practice and has forgotten he ever knew Jessica. As for Hippy, Nora says that he is studying night and day, and that he is actually wearing himself away by burning midnight oil.
column3: He is head over heels in football practice and has forgotten he ever knew Jessica. As for Hippy, Nora says that he is studying night and day, and that he is actually wearing himself away by burning midnight oil.

column2: Yes, Hippy is studying some this year, replied David.
column3: Yes, Hippy is studying some this year, replied David.

column2: You know Hippy never bothered himself much about study, just managed to scrape through.
column3: You know Hippy never bothered himself much about study, just managed to scrape through.

column2: But now he'll have to hustle if he gets through with High School this year, and he's wide awake to that fact."
column3: But now he'll have to hustle if he gets through with High School this year, and he's wide awake to that fact."

column2: You'll have to have better excuses than football and experiments.
column3: You'll have to have better excuses than football and experiments.

column2: I'll tell you what we'll do to square ourselves, said David, smiling. "We'll take you girls to the football game next Thursday.
column3: I'll tell you what we'll do to square ourselves, said David, smiling. "We'll take you girls to the football game next Thursday.

column2: Reddy's on the team, but Hippy and I will do the honors."
column3: Reddy's on the team, but Hippy and I will do the honors."

column2: Fine, replied Grace.
column3: Fine, replied Grace.

column2: But are you willing to burden yourselves with some extra girls?	But are you willing to burden yourselves with some extra girls?
You see it's this way.
column3: You see it's this way.

column2: One of the things that our sorority has pledged itself to do this year is to look up the stray girls in High School, and see that they are not lonely and homesick during holiday seasons.
column3: One of the things that our sorority has pledged itself to do this year is to look up the stray girls in High School, and see that they are not lonely and homesick during holiday seasons.

column2: Mrs. Gray had planned a party for us, but when we told her what we were about to do, she gave up her party and agreed to go to mine instead, on condition that Anne's family, plus Anne's two guests, should have dinner with her.
column3: mrs Gray had planned a party for us, but when we told her what we were about to do, she gave up her party and agreed to go to mine instead, on condition that Anne's family, plus Anne's two guests, should have dinner with her.

column2: Bless her dear heart, said David, "she is always thinking of the pleasure of others.
column3: Bless her dear heart, said David, "she is always thinking of the pleasure of others.

column2: Now about the football game.
column3: Now about the football game.

column2: Bring your girls along and I'll do my best to give them a good time, although I'm generally anything but a success with new girls.
column3: Bring your girls along and I'll do my best to give them a good time, although I'm generally anything but a success with new girls.

column2: However, Hippy makes up for what I lack.
column3: However, Hippy makes up for what I lack.

column2: He can entertain a regiment of them, and not even exert himself. Now I must leave you, for I have a very important engagement at home."
column3: He can entertain a regiment of them, and not even exert himself. Now I must leave you, for I have a very important engagement at home."

column2: In the laboratory, I suppose, said Anne teasingly.
column3: In the laboratory, I suppose, said Anne teasingly.

column2: Just so, replied David.
column3: Just so, replied David.

column2: Good-bye, girls.	Good bye, girls.
Let me know how many tickets you want for the game." He raised his cap, mounted his machine and was off down the street.
column3: Let me know how many tickets you want for the game." He raised his cap, mounted his machine and was off down the street.

column2: We do seem to be getting awfully serious and settled of late, replied Anne.
column3: We do seem to be getting awfully serious and settled of late, replied Anne.

column2: We've had so many special meetings."
column3: We've had so many special meetings."

column2: Last season seems like a dream to me now."
column3: Last season seems like a dream to me now."

column2: I have forgiven, long ago, but I have not forgotten the way some of those girls performed last year.	I have forgiven, long ago, but I have not forgotten the way some of those girls performed last year.
It was remarkable that things ever straightened themselves.
column3: It was remarkable that things ever straightened themselves.

column2: Anne pressed Grace's hand by way of answer.
column3: Anne pressed Grace's hand by way of answer.

column2: The sophomore year had been crowded with many trials, some of them positive school tragedies, in which Anne and Grace had been the principal actors.
column3: The sophomore year had been crowded with many trials, some of them positive school tragedies, in which Anne and Grace had been the principal actors.

column2: What are you two mooning over? asked a gay voice, and the two girls turned with a start to find Julia Crosby grinning cheerfully at them.
column3: What are you two mooning over? asked a gay voice, and the two girls turned with a start to find Julia Crosby grinning cheerfully at them.

column2: O Julia, how glad I am to see you at close range! exclaimed Grace. "Admiring you from a distance isn't a bit satisfactory."
column3: O Julia, how glad I am to see you at close range! exclaimed Grace. "Admiring you from a distance isn't a bit satisfactory."

column2: That's the only thing that keeps me from your side.	That's the only thing that keeps me from your side.
The duties of the class president are many and irksome.
column3: The duties of the class president are many and irksome.

column2: At the present moment I've a duty on hand that I don't in the least relish, and I want your august assistance.
column3: At the present moment I've a duty on hand that I don't in the least relish, and I want your august assistance.

column2: Why, of course, answered Grace and Anne in the same breath.
column3: Why, of course, answered Grace and Anne in the same breath.

column2: What is it you want us to do?
column3: What is it you want us to do?

column2: Well, it seems that some of your juniors are still in need of discipline.	Well, it seems that some of your juniors are still in need of discipline.
You remember the hatchet that we buried last year with such pomp and ceremony?"
column3: You remember the hatchet that we buried last year with such pomp and ceremony?"

column2: Yes, yes, was the answer.
column3: Yes, yes, was the answer.

column2: This morning I overheard certain girls planning to go out to the Omnibus House after school to-morrow and dig up the poor hatchet and flaunt it in the seniors' faces the day of the opening basketball game, simply to rattle us.	This morning I overheard certain girls planning to go out to the Omnibus House after school to morrow and dig up the poor hatchet and flaunt it in the seniors' faces the day of the opening basketball game, simply to rattle us.
Just as though it wouldn't upset your team as much as ours.
column3: Just as though it wouldn't upset your team as much as ours.

column2: It's an idiotic trick, at any rate, and anything but funny.
column3: It's an idiotic trick, at any rate, and anything but funny.

column2: Now I propose to take four of our class, and you must select four of yours. We'll hustle out there the minute school is over to-morrow, and be ready to receive the marauders when they arrive.
column3: Now I propose to take four of our class, and you must select four of yours. We'll hustle out there the minute school is over to morrow, and be ready to receive the marauders when they arrive.

column2: Select your girls, but don't tell them what you want or they may tell some one about it beforehand."
column3: Select your girls, but don't tell them what you want or they may tell some one about it beforehand."

column2: Who are the girls, Julia?	Who are the girls, Julia?
Are you sure they're juniors?"
column3: Are you sure they're juniors?"

column2: The two I heard talking are juniors.	The two I heard talking are juniors.
Tell us who they are, Julia, said Grace.
column3: Tell us who they are, Julia, said Grace.

column2: We don't want to go into this blindfolded.
column3: We don't want to go into this blindfolded.

column2: Wait and see, replied Julia tantalizingly.
column3: Wait and see, replied Julia tantalizingly.

column2: Then you'll feel more indignant and can help my cause along all the better.	Then you'll feel more indignant and can help my cause along all the better.
I give you my word that the girls I overheard talking are not particular friends of yours. You aren't going to back out, are you, and leave me without proper support?"
column3: I give you my word that the girls I overheard talking are not particular friends of yours. You aren't going to back out, are you, and leave me without proper support?"

column2: Of course not, laughed Grace.
column3: Of course not, laughed Grace.

column2: Don't worry.	Don't worry.
We'll support you, only you must agree to do all the talking."
column3: We'll support you, only you must agree to do all the talking."

column2: I shall endeavor to overcome their insane freshness with a few well-chosen words, Julia promised.
column3: I shall endeavor to overcome their insane freshness with a few well chosen words, Julia promised.

column2: Be sure and be on hand early.
column3: Be sure and be on hand early.

column2: Grace chose Anne, Nora, Jessica and Marian Barber, the latter three being considerably mystified at her request, but nevertheless agreeing to be on hand when school closed.
column3: Grace chose Anne, Nora, Jessica and Marian Barber, the latter three being considerably mystified at her request, but nevertheless agreeing to be on hand when school closed.

column2: They were met at the gate by Julia and four other seniors, and the whole party set out for the Omnibus House without delay.
column3: They were met at the gate by Julia and four other seniors, and the whole party set out for the Omnibus House without delay.

column2: Grace walked with Julia, and the two girls found plenty to say to each other during the walk.
column3: Grace walked with Julia, and the two girls found plenty to say to each other during the walk.

column2: Julia was studying hard, she told Grace.
column3: Julia was studying hard, she told Grace.

column2: She wanted to enter Smith next year.
column3: She wanted to enter Smith next year.

column2: I don't know where I shall go after I finish High School, said Grace. "Ethel Post wants me to go to Wellesley.
column3: I don't know where I shall go after I finish High School, said Grace. "Ethel Post wants me to go to Wellesley.

column2: She'll be a junior when I'm a freshman.
column3: She'll be a junior when I'm a freshman.

column2: But I don't know whether I should like Wellesley.
column3: But I don't know whether I should like Wellesley.

column2: I shall not try to decide where I want to go for a while yet."
column3: I shall not try to decide where I want to go for a while yet."

column2: Wherever we are we'll write and always be friends, said Julia, and Grace warmly acquiesced.
column3: Wherever we are we'll write and always be friends, said Julia, and Grace warmly acquiesced.

column2: As they neared the old Omnibus House they could see no one about.
column3: As they neared the old Omnibus House they could see no one about.

column2: We're early! exclaimed Julia.
column3: We're early! exclaimed Julia.

column2: The enemy has not arrived.	The enemy has not arrived.
Thank goodness, it's not cold to-day or we might have a chilly vigil.
column3: Thank goodness, it's not cold to day or we might have a chilly vigil.

column2: Now listen, all ye faithful, while I set forth the object of this walk." She thereupon related what Grace and Anne already knew.
column3: Now listen, all ye faithful, while I set forth the object of this walk." She thereupon related what Grace and Anne already knew.

column2: It isn't the hatchet we care for, it's the principle of the thing.	It isn't the hatchet we care for, it's the principle of the thing.
Give them what they deserve, Julia."
column3: Give them what they deserve, Julia."

column2: Never fear, replied Julia.
column3: Never fear, replied Julia.

column2: I'll effectually attend to their case.	I'll effectually attend to their case.
Now we'd better dodge around the corner and keep out of sight until they get here.
column3: Now we'd better dodge around the corner and keep out of sight until they get here.

column2: Then we'll swoop down upon them unawares."
column3: Then we'll swoop down upon them unawares."

column2: They had not waited long before they heard voices.
column3: They had not waited long before they heard voices.

column2: They're coming, whispered Julia.
column3: They're coming, whispered Julia.

column2: There are eight of them.	There are eight of them.
Form in line and when they get nicely started, we'll circle about them and hem them in.
column3: Form in line and when they get nicely started, we'll circle about them and hem them in.

column2: The girls waited in silence.
column3: The girls waited in silence.

column2: They have trowels, Julia informed them from time to time.
column3: They have trowels, Julia informed them from time to time.

column2: They have a spade.	They have a spade.
They've begun to dig, and they are having their own troubles, for the ground is hard.
column3: They've begun to dig, and they are having their own troubles, for the ground is hard.

column2: All ready! March!"
column3: All ready! March!"

column2: Softly the procession approached the spot where the marauders were energetically digging.
column3: Softly the procession approached the spot where the marauders were energetically digging.

column2: The girl using the spade was Eleanor.
column3: The girl using the spade was Eleanor.

column2: Now I'm in for it, groaned Grace.
column3: Now I'm in for it, groaned Grace.

column2: She's down on me now, and she'll be sure to think I organized the whole thing. For an instant Grace regretted making the promise to Julia, before learning the situation; then, holding her head a trifle more erect, she decided to make the best of her unfortunate predicament.
column3: She's down on me now, and she'll be sure to think I organized the whole thing. For an instant Grace regretted making the promise to Julia, before learning the situation; then, holding her head a trifle more erect, she decided to make the best of her unfortunate predicament.

column2: It isn't Julia's fault, she thought.
column3: It isn't Julia's fault, she thought.

column2: She probably knows nothing about our acquaintance with Eleanor; besides, Eleanor has no business to play such tricks.	She probably knows nothing about our acquaintance with Eleanor; besides, Eleanor has no business to play such tricks.
Edna Wright must have told her all about last year."
column3: Edna Wright must have told her all about last year."

column2: Her reflections were cut short, for one of the girls glanced up from her digging with a sudden exclamation which drew all eyes toward Julia and her party.
column3: Her reflections were cut short, for one of the girls glanced up from her digging with a sudden exclamation which drew all eyes toward Julia and her party.

column2: Well, little folks, said Julia in mock surprise, "what sort of a party is this?
column3: Well, little folks, said Julia in mock surprise, "what sort of a party is this?

column2: At Julia's first words Eleanor dropped the small spade she held and straightened up, the picture of defiance.
column3: At Julia's first words Eleanor dropped the small spade she held and straightened up, the picture of defiance.

column2: The other diggers looked sheepishly at Julia, who stood eyeing them in a way that made them feel "too foolish for anything," as one of them afterwards expressed it.
column3: The other diggers looked sheepishly at Julia, who stood eyeing them in a way that made them feel "too foolish for anything," as one of them afterwards expressed it.

column2: Why don't you answer me, little girls? asked Julia.
column3: Why don't you answer me, little girls? asked Julia.

column2: This was too much for Eleanor.
column3: This was too much for Eleanor.

column2: How dare you speak to us in that manner and treat us as though we were children? she burst forth.
column3: How dare you speak to us in that manner and treat us as though we were children? she burst forth.

column2: What business is it of yours why we are here?	What business is it of yours why we are here?
Do you?
column3: Do you?

column2: No, replied Eleanor a trifle less rudely, "but we have as much right here as you have."
column3: No, replied Eleanor a trifle less rudely, "but we have as much right here as you have."

column2: Granted, replied Julia calmly.
column3: Granted, replied Julia calmly.

column2: However, there is this difference. You are here to make mischief and we are here to prevent it, and, furthermore, are going to do so.
column3: However, there is this difference. You are here to make mischief and we are here to prevent it, and, furthermore, are going to do so.

column2: Just this, replied Julia.
column3: Just this, replied Julia.

column2: Last year the girls belonging to the present senior and junior classes met on this very spot and amicably disposed of a two-year-old class grudge.	Last year the girls belonging to the present senior and junior classes met on this very spot and amicably disposed of a two year old class grudge.
Emblematic of this they buried a hatchet, once occupying a humble though honorable position in the Crosby family, but cheerfully sacrificed for the good of the cause.
column3: Emblematic of this they buried a hatchet, once occupying a humble though honorable position in the Crosby family, but cheerfully sacrificed for the good of the cause.

column2: Yesterday, continued Julia, "I overheard two juniors plotting to get possession of this same hatchet for the purpose of flaunting it in the faces of the seniors at the opening basketball game.
column3: Yesterday, continued Julia, "I overheard two juniors plotting to get possession of this same hatchet for the purpose of flaunting it in the faces of the seniors at the opening basketball game.

column2: Therefore I decided to take a hand in things, and here I am, backed by girls from both classes, who are of the self-same mind."
column3: Therefore I decided to take a hand in things, and here I am, backed by girls from both classes, who are of the self same mind."

column2: Really, Miss Crosby, said Edna Wright, "you are very amusing."
column3: Really, Miss Crosby, said Edna Wright, "you are very amusing."

column2: My friends all think so, returned Julia sweetly, "but never mind now about my amusing qualities, Edna.
column3: My friends all think so, returned Julia sweetly, "but never mind now about my amusing qualities, Edna.

column2: Let's talk about the present situation."
column3: Let's talk about the present situation."

column2: She looked at Edna with the old-time aggravating smile that was always warranted to further incense her opponent.
column3: She looked at Edna with the old time aggravating smile that was always warranted to further incense her opponent.

column2: It had its desired effect, for Edna fairly bristled with indignation and was about to make a furious reply when she was pushed aside by Eleanor, who said loftily, "Allow me to talk to this person, Edna."
column3: It had its desired effect, for Edna fairly bristled with indignation and was about to make a furious reply when she was pushed aside by Eleanor, who said loftily, "Allow me to talk to this person, Edna."

column2: No, said Julia resolutely, every vestige of a smile leaving her face at Eleanor's words.
column3: No, said Julia resolutely, every vestige of a smile leaving her face at Eleanor's words.

column2: But you have with you seven girls who do know all about the enmity that was buried here last spring, and who ought to have enough good sense to know that this afternoon's performance is liable to bring it to life again.
column3: But you have with you seven girls who do know all about the enmity that was buried here last spring, and who ought to have enough good sense to know that this afternoon's performance is liable to bring it to life again.

column2: If you girls carry this hatchet to school and exhibit it to the seniors on the day of the game you are apt to start bad feeling all over again, she said, turning to the others.
column3: If you girls carry this hatchet to school and exhibit it to the seniors on the day of the game you are apt to start bad feeling all over again, she said, turning to the others.

column2: That's the reason I asked Grace to appoint a committee of juniors and come out here with me.	That's the reason I asked Grace to appoint a committee of juniors and come out here with me.

I feel sure that under the circumstances the absent members of both classes would agree with us if they were present. Digging up a rusty old hatchet is nothing, but digging up a rusty old grudge is quite another matter.
column3: I feel sure that under the circumstances the absent members of both classes would agree with us if they were present. Digging up a rusty old hatchet is nothing, but digging up a rusty old grudge is quite another matter.

column2: We didn't come here to quarrel, but I appeal to you, as members of the junior class, to think before you do something that is bound to cause us all annoyance and perhaps unhappiness."
column3: We didn't come here to quarrel, but I appeal to you, as members of the junior class, to think before you do something that is bound to cause us all annoyance and perhaps unhappiness."

column2: There was complete silence after Julia finished speaking.
column3: There was complete silence after Julia finished speaking.

column2: Eleanor alone looked belligerent.
column3: Eleanor alone looked belligerent.

column2: Perhaps we'd better let the old hatchet alone, Daisy Culver said sullenly.
column3: Perhaps we'd better let the old hatchet alone, Daisy Culver said sullenly.

column2: The fun is all spoiled now, and everyone will know about it before school begins to-morrow.
column3: The fun is all spoiled now, and everyone will know about it before school begins to morrow.

column2: Daisy, how can you say so? exclaimed Grace, who, fearing a scene with Eleanor, had hitherto remained silent.
column3: Daisy, how can you say so? exclaimed Grace, who, fearing a scene with Eleanor, had hitherto remained silent.

column2: You know perfectly well that none of us will say anything about it.	You know perfectly well that none of us will say anything about it.
This was Eleanor's opportunity.
column3: This was Eleanor's opportunity.

column2: Turning furiously on Grace, her eyes flashing, she exclaimed: "Yes, there is one girl who would tell anything, and that girl is you!
column3: Turning furiously on Grace, her eyes flashing, she exclaimed: "Yes, there is one girl who would tell anything, and that girl is you!

column2: You pretend to be honorable and high-principled, but you are nothing but a hypocrite and a sneak. I would not trust you as far as I could see you.
column3: You pretend to be honorable and high principled, but you are nothing but a hypocrite and a sneak. I would not trust you as far as I could see you.

column2: You seem determined to meddle with matters that do not concern you, and I warn you that if you do not change your tactics you may regret it.
column3: You seem determined to meddle with matters that do not concern you, and I warn you that if you do not change your tactics you may regret it.

column2: You seem to think yourself the idol of your class, but there are some of the girls who are too clever to be deceived.	You seem to think yourself the idol of your class, but there are some of the girls who are too clever to be deceived.
They do not belong among the number who trail tamely after you, either.
column3: They do not belong among the number who trail tamely after you, either.

column2: And now I wish to say that I despise you and all your friends, and wish never to speak to any of you again.
column3: And now I wish to say that I despise you and all your friends, and wish never to speak to any of you again.

column2: Let them keep their trumpery hatchet."
column3: Let them keep their trumpery hatchet."

column2: With these words she turned and stalked across the field to the road, where her runabout stood.
column3: With these words she turned and stalked across the field to the road, where her runabout stood.

column2: After an instant's hesitation, she was followed by Edna, Daisy Culver and those who had come with her. Henceforth there would again be two distinct factions in the junior class.
column3: After an instant's hesitation, she was followed by Edna, Daisy Culver and those who had come with her. Henceforth there would again be two distinct factions in the junior class.

column2: Good gracious, exclaimed Julia Crosby.
column3: Good gracious, exclaimed Julia Crosby.

column2: What on earth did you ever do to her, Grace?"
column3: What on earth did you ever do to her, Grace?"

column2: But Grace could not answer.
column3: But Grace could not answer.

column2: She was winking hard to keep back the tears. Twice she attempted to speak and failed.
column3: She was winking hard to keep back the tears. Twice she attempted to speak and failed.

column2: I can't help feeling badly, said Grace, with a sob.
column3: I can't help feeling badly, said Grace, with a sob.

column2: She said such dreadful things.
column3: She said such dreadful things.

column2: No one who knows you would believe them, replied Julia.
column3: No one who knows you would believe them, replied Julia.

column2: By the way, who is she?	By the way, who is she?
I'll tell you about her as we walk along, replied Grace, wiping her eyes and smiling a little.
column3: I'll tell you about her as we walk along, replied Grace, wiping her eyes and smiling a little.

column2: The battle is over.	The battle is over.
No one has been killed and only one wounded.
column3: No one has been killed and only one wounded.
